title: Colin Powell Presents False WMD Evidence to UN Security Council
summary: Secretary of State Colin Powell delivered a 76-minute presentation to the UN Security Council presenting fabricated evidence to justify the Iraq War. Powell's presentation included: mobile weapons labs based on testimony from 'Curveball,' a source who later admitted lying; aluminum tubes claims his own staff warned were 'not credible'; and a theatrical anthrax vial demonstration. The CIA and State Department had warned that many claims were false before the presentation. Powell later called the presentation a 'blot' on his record, acknowledging the evidence was fabricated. This false presentation became central to the Bush administration's justification for the 2003 Iraq invasion.

sources.title: Powell's UN speech on Iraq WMDs: A 'blot' on his record
The Truth About Colin Powell's WMD Presentation

notes: Powell's presentation was based on fabricated intelligence including 'Curveball' testimony and aluminum tubes claims that intelligence agencies had warned were unreliable. The presentation became the centerpiece of the Bush administration's case for war despite internal warnings about the evidence's credibility. Powell himself later acknowledged it as a permanent 'blot' on his record.
